sessions.title: Understanding Foundational Literacy and Numeracy in Hindi Context
objectives: Understand the concept and importance of FLN in NEP 2020
Identify FLN gaps in diverse classroom contexts
Apply basic FLN assessment techniques
sessions.trainerNotes: Use examples of Hindi folk tales to illustrate the importance of FLN. Discuss how to adapt assessment techniques for low-infrastructure settings, such as using oral quizzes and peer assessment.

sessions.title: Story-Based Reading Activities for Early Grades in Low-Resource Settings
objectives: Use local oral stories for reading instruction
Design reading activities without printed materials
Assess comprehension through oral retelling
sessions.trainerNotes: Emphasize the use of local Hindi stories and encourage teachers to create their own stories using everyday objects. Discuss how to use storytelling to promote cultural sensitivity and inclusivity.

sessions.title: Creating Low-Resource Teaching-Learning Materials for Hindi Classes
objectives: Create effective TLMs using locally available materials
Design zero-cost learning aids from natural and recycled items
Involve students in TLM creation
sessions.trainerNotes: Provide examples of low-cost materials that can be used to create TLMs, such as recycled paper and natural materials. Encourage teachers to involve students in the creation process to promote ownership and engagement.

sessions.title: Formative Assessment in FLN for Low-Infrastructure Settings
objectives: Use oral assessment methods for early literacy
Create simple observation checklists
Document progress without formal testing infrastructure
sessions.trainerNotes: Discuss how to use oral assessment methods, such as class discussions and peer feedback, to monitor student progress. Emphasize the importance of documenting progress through observation and anecdotal records.
